definition: to go wrong/to get into trouble

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Troubles occurred only in places where the Party committees had failed to give proper guidance .
sentences.chinese: 出乱子的地方都是党委没有好好去指导。

sentences.english: The police are standing by in case of trouble.
sentences.chinese: 警察已在待命行动，以防出乱子。

sentences.english: If they appoint Smithson manager there'll be trouble with the staff as sure as God made little apples.
sentences.chinese: 如果史密森被任命为经理，职员中一定会出乱子。

sentences.english: How can a family get disfunctional?
sentences.chinese: 一个家庭是怎样出乱子的？

sentences.english: Basically, if the price don't go wrong, we will place orders immediately.
sentences.chinese: 基本上，如果价格不出乱子，我们会立即下订单。

sentences.english: Trouble is blowing up again in….
He had never been but once at a tiger-hunt, when the accident in question occurred.
sentences.chinese: 其实他只猎过一次虎，就是出乱子的那一回。

sentences.english: One must not take such things lightly, thinking that they won't cause disturbances.
sentences.chinese: 不要以为这样搞就不会出乱子，可以掉以轻心。

sentences.english: Elsewhere, doctors can buy insurance to protect themselves in case they make mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 在其他地方，医生可以买保险，以防自己出乱子。

definition: to go wrong/to take a wrong turning
to take a wrong turn/to go wrong
in a mess/upside down
to act arbitrarily regardless of the rules/to mess with sth/to make a hash of things/to cause trouble
to make a mess of sth
to stir up trouble/to get into trouble
branch road/setback/accident/hiccup
a new branch grows out of a knot (idiom); fig. side issues keep arising
fatal/resulting in sb's death
to divulge secrets
to hold things up/to make a botch of things
to hand someone the swordhilt (idiom)/to give someone a hold on oneself
a conflict arises close to home (idiom)
disturbance/incident
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
to create a big disturbance
